intro: Pentaschistis eriostoma, commonly known as the hairy pentaschistis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves, which give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to regions in Asia, particularly in countries like India and China. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
